DOCNAME: CASE OF FARCAȘ AND OTHERS v. ROMANIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court)
JUDGES: Egidijus Kūris;Iulia Motoc;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in LOC .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a group of engineers patented an invention concerning a method for separating hydrocarbon . The first applicant is one of the inventors . The second and third applicants are heirs of the other members of the group .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an action for compensation against company NORP , a privately - owned former ORG company which had used the DATE invention DATE ( for details about those proceedings , see PERSON and Others v. GPE , no . GPE , § § CARDINAL , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . NORP In a decision of DATE ORG allowed in part the action lodged by the applicants against company NORP , and ordered the latter to pay to the first applicant MONEY ( ROL ) , an amount representing compensation for the use , DATE , of the invention patented in DATE . The second and third applicants appealed , and in a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG also awarded them compensation – ROL CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL to the second applicant and ORG to the third applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants and company NORP signed an agreement for the payment of the compensation awarded by the court . CARDINAL DATE the company paid PERCENT of the amounts granted .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG and ORG took note of the terms of the agreement of DATE and concluded that company NORP had withdrawn its appeal on points of law against the decision of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph DATE above ) , which thus became final .
CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE company NORP had sought its judicial reorganisation under a procedure provided for by Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on judicial reorganisation and bankruptcy .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the application , started the reorganisation proceedings and nominated a judicial administrator . The applicants’ claims were accepted by ORG and recorded in the register of claims compiled by the judicial administrator in conformity with the provisions of the applicable law ( tabloul creditorilor , hereinafter “ the register of claims ” ) .

CARDINAL . The applicants lodged an objection to the register of claims , asking to be recognised as priority creditors ( creditori privilegiaţi ) . CARDINAL other creditors also lodged objections against the records in the register of claims .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE the judicial administrator had submitted a reorganisation plan to a vote by the creditors . It was proposed that the priority claims ( creanţe privilegiate ) be paid in full , and the remaining unsecured non - priority claims ( creanţe chirografare ) be paid at a rate of PERCENT of their value . In an interlocutory judgment of DATE the ORG validated the plan after examining the objections raised by the unsecured creditors ( creditori chirografari ) . In DATE company NORP paid its debts in accordance with the plan .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing on the objections to the register of claims lodged by the applicants . The first applicant was present at the hearing to represent both himself and the other applicants . ORG gave the parties until DATE to submit written observations . On DATE , in the applicants’ absence , it adjourned delivery of the judgment to CARDINAL DATE . ORG gave its judgment on DATE ; it found against the applicants .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in accordance with the rules on notification in relation to court documents in insolvency proceedings ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , the judgment of CARDINAL DATE was published in ORG ( PERSON , “ the Bulletin ” ) .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicants enquired about the judgment ’s date of delivery and asked ORG to provide them with a copy of the judgment , which was sent to them on DATE ; they received it on DATE . On DATE they lodged an appeal by post .
CARDINAL . Before ORG , the applicants argued that , as they had not had access to the Bulletin , they had not been able to know on which date the judgment had been published .

CARDINAL . In a final decision of DATE ORG dismissed that argument and concluded that the appeal had been made out of time , as it had been lodged DATE after DATE , the date on which ORG judgment had been published ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . Relying on ORG decision no . CARDINAL of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , ORG considered that the notification procedure via the Bulletin had offered sufficient safeguards to the participants in the proceedings , and had been justified by the nature of the insolvency procedure .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG closed the insolvency proceedings and noted that company NORP had complied with all the obligations set out in the reorganisation plan ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , and thus it no longer had any debts .
